subject: Business
title: Psychological Safety in Teams
description: Learn Psychological Safety in Teams in one minute.

hook.text: Google studied its best teams for two years. The top factor wasn't talent or experience. It was psychological safety.

buildup.text: Psychological safety means team members feel safe to take risks, ask questions, and admit mistakes.

discovery.text: In safe teams, errors are reported early. In unsafe ones, they're hidden â€” until they become catastrophes.

twist.text: High-performing teams have more reported errors, not fewer. They just catch and fix them faster.

climax.text: Amy Edmondson found hospitals with better error reporting had lower patient mortality. Safety saves lives.

punchline.text: The best teams aren't fearless. They're safe enough to be honest.

quiz.question: What was the number one factor in Google's highest-performing teams?
